title: New subscription model shows lack of integrity
text: I have to say that this system was passable until the recent  pricing model overhaul. Many of us brought into Skydrop on the basis of no additional charges and were really put off when the functionality of our controllers was hijacked with less than 2 week notice.  As we learned in a general communication from some former Skydrop employees there were dire business reasons for the timing and lack of transparency. Had that transparency been offered when the company made the decision to cease operations in 2018 I am sure that the response from users could have been different.  As it is I wish the few dedicated former employees well as they try to maintain the web services for the Skydrop customers.

title: I can accept their honesty now! Changed my rating.
text:
I have had the Skydrop now for a couple years! It was not the cheapest product to purchase. They just did an update to their current app and took away too many of the features that I used every single day for the past few years! I now understand why the company needs to charge a fee to keep it going! I was not happy at first but ok with it now. Here is a bit of the email..
“We sincerely apologize for this unwelcome news. Our hope is that our customers will see the value in the service and be willing to contribute to the ongoing costs of the system. We’ve also decided to disable, for now, the option to pay the yearly fee with an in-app purchase. We want to avoid the situation where the company accepts money for services they are unable to deliver.
Thank you for your passion and support of Skydrop.”
I wish they would’ve been upfront from the beginning. I’m changing from a 1 to a 4 because they changed, apologized and are trying to be honest and transparent as far as I can tell.

title: Can’t beat the savings!!!
text:
I checked 6 years back before my sky drop. My water bill in the summer (so cal) was $200 plus  a month to keep the grass green. After getting the Skydrop, it dropped considerably as low $116 in August!!! Of course cost has risen but I checked the last 2 summers and it still has not exceeded $160 month. Remember I’m only talking about 1 months bill, so the savings has been several hundreds since getting the Skydrop in 2015. People are upset about $2/month. This is a no brainer.  And I will also say their customer support is 5 Star. When I have had technical issues in the past, they took care of it. 

Come on people, they have provided a service that for free for years, and I can only assume that now the programming will equate to greater savings both monetarily and for our environment.

It’s amazing people will spend thousands for an iPhone or Apple TV device, and then spend hundreds more for all the subscriptions required. This isn’t a new concept by any means.

title: The “update” renders an already bad app totally worthless
text:
Just a few weeks ago the app stopped allowing me to log in, saying password was wrong (I never changed it).  Then I chose “forgot password” and was told I would get an email with the password reset link. Nope.  Never arrived, not in spam, just didn’t happen at all.  Yesterday I noticed an update for the app was available on the AppStore and thought “Oh good, they’re going to fix it now!”  Nope.  The app won’t even load beyond a big blue Skydrop logo which just remains on screen indefinitely.

I’ve been a Skydrop customer for over 5 years.  The system has never worked better than when I first started using it.  Weather accuracy was never good.  It could be raining and Skydrop would still schedule watering as if no rain in the forecast (or even at the moment).  My lawn has died in spots and I’ve reseeded more times than I’d like to remember because of spotty watering performance.  

I believe the company is going out of business.  If you’re looking for a smart sprinkler controller, look elsewhere.  Don’t be fooled by the fancy display and pretty lighted ring.  This system is crap, and the app is now useless.

title: Update: Worthless
text:
Update: Skydrop sent out a letter stating the company is in a financial hardship and that many employees have had to find other employment. Some very loyal and dedicated personnel are trying to keep the product going and the only way was to charge a minimal fee for the cloud use. Skydrop admits they should have sent a letter out in advance, but we all make mistakes and I am pleased they owned up to theirs. I don’t live a perfect life so I don’t hold others to that expectation!!!!

This has been a great product and spending $2 month is still cheaper than buying a new controller; $24 opposed to $200. I would give 5 stars but it doesn’t work well with Alexa and the future stability is questionable, so I give a solid 4 stars!!! 

Product was great until the last update. Company decided to charge for functions on the app. Now the app is worthless without a subscription. The app has had minor bugs since I bought the controller 2 years ago, but the overall product was great.

I have now changed my opinion as I had no notice this was coming. I have spent a day trying to figure out why my yard was turning brown and it wasn’t til I read an app review I found out the app isn’t operating the controller. Now I have a $200 “smart” controller that I have to operate like a basic Rainbird controller. I should have saved a $150 and went with the basic!

title: Avoid this bait and switch junk!
text:
After being one of the original adopters of skydrop it’s finally time to leave and go with a Rachio system!

So I was baited and switched into buying the expansion module not for the extra sones as I only have 6 but for the rain sensor option which they said would be a required firmware update for it to work. Was told it was coming in 3 months well after 4 years later I’m still waiting! 

Then to make matters worse they now want to change me just to be able to control my system! 

I could of done the same control for free if they didn’t block my access or if they cared about there customers they would release the api so I could setup my own server connection.

And before they reply with the open letter to customers junk that doesn’t dust any mustard with me!

I paid good money for the expansion zone that was a total waste of money! And then paid lots for the system for it to not work as it should.

They say about hyper localised weather reporting it uses well it was raining all day but still it wanted to water the yard!

The junk can’t even Intergeator to my home weather station that’s connected to various weather sites and reports current weather.

At least my new rachio system can get info from my weather station!

So in short dump skydrop kick them to the kerb and get a rachio 3 you won’t be disappointed!

They only disappointment your have is with skydrop!
They should be dropped from the sky into the garbage landfill site!

title: Shady company breaching contract.
text:
After owning the device on the promise of free-forever remote access and weather data, they now expect to charge a monthly fee, or render this unit useless. They refuse to take it back since it’s been more than 30 days, effectively locking me in in their system, not allowing me to move to some other vendor that keeps up to their promises.  

Not only their mediocre ‘hyper accurate’ ‘hyper local’ weather info never really worked, now I can’t modify the schedule or manually activate/ deactivate zones. In addition to that, access using the hardware itself is garbage, due to the system being awfully slow and unresponsive, so basically I have a sub or unit performing worse than my formes $30 dum controller. 

If they really cared about customers, they’d make a system update where I can run the controller from my own server (think ubiquity unifi controller), instead of forcing me on their cloud service, and then lock me out of my hardware and try and collect random money.

title: Worth $2/mo if it weren’t so buggy
text:
I’m perfectly happy to pay $2/mo for a useful software service. But it has to at least work!

This app is completely buggy nowadays, which makes it almost unusable. It didn’t used to be this bad, but it really is terrible now. The app just crashes all the time, fails to save changes, locks up and refuses to scroll after certain actions, until you force-quit and re-launch... I mean come on, guys. I’ll give it the rest of the summer for you to fix your issues, but if it’s not fixed by the end of the summer, I’d rather spend money to replace this with something else that actually works.

UPDATE: I signed up for the subscription after the latest app update made it required... hoping maybe the bugs were fixed, too. The functionality is all there, but it’s still just as buggy as ever.

title: Hyper accurate weather is a joke
text:
I have to stop it watering during a week long rain.   The hyper-accurate weather gimmick is just that....an excuse to now start charging a monthly service fee of 1.99 when I have had this expensive hardware for 3 years that I have to continually monitor and manage. Unacceptable shady company that will loose future customers and existing ones alike due to greed.   Good luck going out of business.

And they did respond to this review, with the open letter they had published last week.   I appreciate the response, but it did nothing to address the lack- or should I say non-existence of hyperaccurate weather which is the reason they are charging the monthly maintenance fee.  Offer an option with non weather based control from the app for free like before and if customers want the weather based watering then charge the 1.99 monthly fee.   Oh but wait, no one would do this because weather based watering does not work!  Tragic!

title: Demanding subscription fee
text: I have had Sky drop for about couple of the months, purchased it based on its cool sleek look. Was very happy to see finally my yard is getting some smart attention. Until just recently received the email about subscription which made me unhappy. Nevertheless again, tonight I received a second heartfelt email indicating that this young established company is in grave financial situation and even that the $2 monthly subscription may not keep it afloat. Truly the product is good, and I hate to see bunch of  bright start up kids go disappointed. Really, I believe we should not give up on this company for the mere $2, we spend many times  more in a day for no benefit at all. I hope they survive.

title: Dissatisfied and Deceived
text: All my zones are gone from the app., and this was a recent move to make money from us loyal customers. This company removed manual watering so they can extort $2 per month from their customers.  There has always been an issue with this app’s performance and it has gotten worse over time. Now I can’t even control my “smart” controller. Bait n switch seems to be my guess with this company as there are comments that we have to now pay for what was and has been a free service. We paid for the controller and are now being extorted to pay $24 per year to keep using it. If you are basing your purchase of a smart irrigation controller on its app, then buyer beware! I wish I could afford to throw this controller into the trash, delete this app, and go with a reputable brand that does not deceive their customers. I would actually feel bad to sell it to someone else knowing what they will experience.

title: Loved it until they started charging
text: We loved our Skydrop. Even bought one for my parents yard. Until this week when they started charging without any warning. Seriously zero notice. The app was just all of the sudden locked out unless you pay. You can’t even use the main controller unless you pay. If there had been some communication or warning or the option to not use some services and keep it free I might not be as upset. But there was nothing and we have reached out by phone and email without a response. We will be getting a new controller this weekend. It may cost more up front to do that but if the company can’t be trusted to communicate with their customers then that’s not a company I want to give my business to because who knows what they will do next. Very sad about this because we really were very happy with the controller.

title: Password reset doesn’t work, support less than stellar
text: I got new Wi-Fi in the beginning of October, not realizing that I would have to connect the Skydrop unit to the new Wi-Fi. My sprinklers have not worked in four weeks and my lawn and plants are dead now. I used email support and got instructions on how to connect the unit to the new Wi-Fi. One of the necessary steps is to log onto the app on your phone. My password is not working, and the buttons on the App to reset the password do not respond to the touch. The app is useless. I went through the process of changing my password on their website, and still. Useless. The password does not reset. There is no phone support, only email support, and it takes a few days for them to get back to you. In the meantime, my trees are now dying. If they don’t support this app then what good is it?

title: Not worth it
text:
Like the other review, I bought mine three years ago. Always a little slow on WiFi, but still fun to manually water any zone from anywhere. 

That’s all gone. The app is useless now and watering restrictions are the only control you have over watering. 

What’s worse is there customer service. I changed my WiFi password and the controller lost connection. Rather than staying on the current schedule and adhering to my watering restrictions, the controller defaulted to watering every day, but only at night/ early morning so i didn’t notice... until I got my water bill for $1200! That’s when I noticed the password was not updated on the controller and I fixed it. I called Skydrop to see why that was the default behavior and they treated me like I didn’t understand the cloud (I’m a cloud software developer) and were not helpful. A few months after that, the app update included a “back up” schedule option in case WiFi connection is lost....

Needless to say, I’m researching new controller options. If you want to pay the same price for a “smart controller” and only get a better user interface in your garage and an app, this ones for you. If you want to control your sprinklers from your phone/tablet without a fee, this is NOT for you.

title: Used to be a satisfied customer... not anymore!  😡
text:
My time as a customer will be drawing to a close... most likely after this year.  You said there would be no fees to not only use the controller, but also with the app and website.  Well, you changed that and decided to make the app useless unless we pay what is more than double the cost for the watering season.  Really? $2 a month (an absolute hassle to pay monthly) or $18 a year, in what is really just six months for unlimited use of the app/website during the April - October watering season in Utah.  

***An absolute waste of $18 for an app/website that is useless late October into early April.***

What sold me two years ago is the remote use via your easy to use website and app, absolutely free.  Then just recently the excuse came via email of “increased cloud costs” in order to bleed more money out of us as your customers.  To me, that sounds more like a “bait and switch” move.

I’m already looking at new controllers via your competitors.

Extremely disappointed in you Skydrop.  Even more disappointed that I may be giving up on a local business.  If I knew two years ago you were going to do this, I wouldn’t have sent this review and you would have been an afterthought.

Buyer beware!

title: My plants have never been happier!
text: I am so glad that I upgraded from my traditional timer to a Skydrop unit. I love how the app connects to local weather information and bases it's watering times off of it. In the winter months, my sprinklers didn't turn on for two months because Skydrop recognized that it had rained or was about to. This takes all the guesswork out of how often and long you need to set your sprinklers for. If I ever have a sprinkler problem and need to test sprayers out, I like how I can turn the watering zones on and off from my phone  instead of walking to and from the controller unit. My plants are thriving thanks to those who created Skydrop!

title: Subscription Doesn’t Work!
text: I was aggravated to find out that Skydrop was planning to charge a monthly/annual fee for a service that was originally free with purchase of their system. When this took place I went ahead and paid the monthly fee but it still will not let me control my sprinklers from my phone and now my manual control won’t work either. I’ve tried restarting my phone, updating the app, deleting and re-downloading the app but it still won’t update the app. The app shows I’ve paid as well as my iTunes purchases but still my app is frozen and my manual controller is as well. This system is ABSOLUTE garbage! Don’t bother trying to call customer service, you will spend 30+ minutes waiting to be the first caller in line only to be dropped to a voicemail and never receive a call back. My yard has now gone 4 days without being watered.

title: Beyond frustrated.....
text: I have had the skydrop system for about three years now, it was recommended by a friend, who said it was “cutting edge.” We have been happy with it up until the company decided to change things up. If I would have rated the system prior to their change it would have been about three stars. Overnight, without any warning my app just stopped working. To get back what I had they want me to pay a yearly subscription. This company will go out of business if they don’t get their app working again for free (for current customers) like it initially did. Read the warnings people are posting. I think this company is in trouble. Don’t buy this system or app. There are way better options that are cheaper with free apps. Skydrop if you don’t change your ways, your days as a company will be numbered.

title: I paid the upgrade and I am still blocked
text:
Like all the other reviews the system just stopped working last week requiring a monthly or annual fee.  Didn’t like that but $2 a month is better than not having a system at all.  Paid the money and the system is still blocked, at least the computer programs got the section right to accept payment and display that the subscription is current.  But... the system is not unlocked or restored.

We call into customer support (at least five different times), we wait 15 minutes into a queue and the the call is basically dropped when it is your time to speak to a representative and you are told to call back.  This was a MAJOR miscalculation by Skydrop.  Prior to this week EVERYTHING had been great and a 5 star rating would have been deserved.

title: Flip Flop
text: This was a good product until someone at the company had the great idea to start charging people to use the app just to recoup their loses. Bad Idea! Now what was a free app that went along with the product is now stripped down to no control over the product unless you pay. I can understand paying for a new upgraded app with new features, but to take off something that was standard, not cool! The main features that made me buy this product 2+ years ago are gone. I tried calling SkyDrop just to make sure I was reading the app correctly, ended up on hold for 25-30mins just to be transferred to leave a message. No one got back to me. I will switch to a credible brand that’s been around. Whoever authorized the change in the app should be fired because they just killed what was left of your company.

title: Smart function a joke, basic WiFi great when free
text: My halo unit was bought and paid for in 2014, or so I thought.   Right away realized the smart watering, weather, and precipitation control were not working for me.   Quickly programmed my manual schedule and favorite use was app control through WiFi to troubleshoot valve repairs and drip placement and all zone blowout while standing at my compressor.   These functions I loved and cost skydrop nothing so not sure why they disable WiFi operation.   I do know why...ransom money/greed.   For weeks now since the app update, I’ve been standing at the controller and telling it to water all.    Eventually I’ll buy a different brand to get my WiFi function back.   Sure I can afford 2$ a month, but I won’t because of the shady way Skydrop chose to do this.   Hope there is a class action.

title: Do not purchase go get one of the other smart controllers
text: What an absolute waste of time for the last year after purchasing the controller for $200 I used the app to control and set up the system as the controller itself is so un-user friendly, slow and cumbersome. So this year sky drop decide to take that feature from the app and now charge you to control your system from your device with your data???!!! What a joke yeah charge for auto weather or what have you but basic turn on turn off and set up is a joke when your controller is so so so bad. My advice go get one of the other smart controllers that don’t charge you to use the app the set up turn on and off watering remotely. I will have great enjoyment when I pull this device  off my wall and watch it burn in my fire pit. Biggest CON and waste of money ever

title: Another Day
text: After having time to process my disappointment with Skydrop’s news earlier this year, I’m writing a review to support the company.  Before signing up for the recently required monthly subscription, I checked options at the big box stores and nothing compares.  I’ve not experienced any performance issues since purchasing the unit a few years back, and love the sleek appearance and easy to use ap.  I respect the employees tenacity to keep the company viable and appreciate their introspect after earlier misleading communication.  As long as Skydrop maintains development and transparency moving forward, I will continue using their product.

title: AVOID. Sold on one thing and got another.
text:
As you’ll see in the reviews, Skydrop decided to do a bait and switch. Have had the product for a couple of years now and opened the app for the first time in a while to manually run a zone to check some of the sprinkler heads only to find out that now I HAVE TO PAY to manually water a zone. Something that was free all this time. Super disappointed, chose them over bigger names because they were local and wanted to support their innovation.

Instead of innovating more and releasing newer features to that would be worth paying for. Features that benefit themselves and challenge the competition, they choose to charge users for features that have always been included for free.  Lazy way out guys. Disappointed and ready to move on. Look for my Skydrop on KSL.

title: Horrible customer service
text:
I have had this product for three years and worked great and I turned my unit on this spring and the app will not let me control the device anymore and just shows the status. I logged into the website and the same thing. As of now I can’t control my sprinklers and the product is useless. I have been emailing support for a month and no response. I have tried to call them direct and I am on hold for exactly 10 min stating I am next in line and then they say there is no one to accept my call and it hangs up.  This has happened four times in the past two weeks.   Very bad business. I purchased this at Lowe’s. I will be contacting them and letting them know that this company is poorly run. 

What do I do. I will have to purchase a different system.

title: Why I just ordered Rachio instead...
text: Skydrop was everything I wanted and used for last year or so. Up until this month after they Did and update. REMOVED ALL the features and is basically a display in the App. The app basically does nothing now unless you now pay them a monthly fee! This is NOT a Smart Sprinkler system. So if you want to pay hundreds of dollars for a system and then then take away the features and then charge you for them. This is your product. Rachio has all these features plus more and they guarantee they won’t charge you monthly and is HomeKit compatible! Skydrop has cost me now $300+ dollars in equipment for basically 1 year of use. Terrible company. Stay away! Go return it. No wonder their rating went from 4.1 to 2.1 in less than a week.

title: Same as everyone else here. Unhappy b
text: I purchased this controller to compare it to Rachio and hunter.  The other two companies don’t charge for basic contols.  Additional fees are for commercial applications.  Why did Skydrop not grandfather existing customers?  We were sold one thing and then they took it back. So after three years my smart controller is now useless to me and I will have to go to one of the other companies.  When you call the number given you will be on hold for 15 minutes plus just so you can leave a message. I paid but still don’t have access to the old functions. If you  are going to charge us, make sure it works before doing so. Not only am I upset that SD began charging a monthly fee, it still doesn’t work after you do so.

title: Happy with Skydrop
text: This product is great.  Have been using it for two years and I have both saved a ton on my water bill and my grass has never been better.   The recent change is expected.  The more people who use the product the more storage they need so 1.99 cents is not to much to ask.  The amount I have saved in water bills alone has more than offset this additional cost.  Any other product out there will encounter the same issue eventually.   Skydrop is a great product and I highly recommend it.

title: Added paywall to existing essential functionality
text:
I’ve used Skydrop for years and it’s worked well.  I’ve always relied on being able to water zones manually and with the latest app update, that feature and many others have been placed behind a subscription paywall.   They took something that I bought and paid for and made it useless to me.  Can you imagine buying a thermostat and then after having it for years being notified that you will now have to pay to adjust the temperature in your home?  It’s literally unbelievable.  I will be buying a Ranchio and telling everybody that I can, what a rip-off Skydrop is.

Also, at the time of this review their screenshots still show that you can manually start a zone, you cannot.

title: Will destroy your yard. Only an IDIOT WILL BUY
text: Goes offline all the time. Refuses to water for no reason, or floods your yard —no pattern or reason. Refuses to update settings, or appears to update only to revert without warning. Waters during thunderstorms despite using the rain feature. Customer support is rude and useless: each time they start with it must be my error, then blame the last guy I spoke with, then suggest something already tried and in the end accomplish nothing. I have to hand water everything, can’t go anywhere on watering days, or anywhere period for more than a few hours unless I turn the system completely off. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY, BUY ANYTHING EXCEPT THIS USELESS PRODUCT FROM A DISREPUTABLE COMPANY. Forced to pay for the app and yet it STILL DOESNT WORK. ONLY AN IDIOT WOULD BUY!!!!!

title: Was great, now worthless (or worse)
text:
I was a big fan of having a smart sprinkler controller, and really enjoyed knowing it was tied to weather data. I would laugh to myself when neighbors’ sprinklers were running in the rain, knowing that my Skydrop would wait until watering was needed. 

Now they changed the game on us and want a fee to do the only thing you would buy this for, remote access and smart watering. In a matter of days it’s gone from a great benefit in the summer, to something I now have to replace or live with. And suddenly my forecast goes from watering every 3rd day or so, to everyday, with no means of changing it (can’t manually cancel a watering either). Looking into Rachio and Rain Machine now, so there goes another couple hundred dollars.

title: BE WARNED. Bait and switch company
text: I’ve had this thing for 2 years and bout it because it had Wifi and could be controlled by my smart phone. That part seem to work ok as long as the WiFi wasn’t dropping out. Added a additional zone for the wife’s garden and shared the app, well she enjoyed it for a few days before they disabled the app and send some bogus upgrade to pro bull to basically enable what I already had for the last two years. So you’ve been warned keep your old controller because if you don’t pay them you will still be standing in front of this one manually turning it on off programming it just like your old one the only difference is this one cost about 3 times the price of a standard timer smh.

title: Buyer Beware!!
text: This WAS a great product. I have been a loyal customer for three years and highly  recommended this product to more people than I can count. The product worked well for three years and I loved it...until the company suddenly imposed a monthly subscription fee to unlock the app and access weather data (which is what makes the product work). Without it, this is just a RainBird from 1990. They won’t respond to emails or phone calls. I caved and subscribed for a month, only to have my money taken while the app remains locked down. Something stinks here. Based on the plethora of similar reviews across the internet, I suspect Skydrop will soon go under. I would steer clear of this company. Better look at a Rachio.

title: Thanks for charging, switching to Orbit
text:
Your competitors must love you!  You moved to a subscription model and didn’t even grandfather in your existing customers or bother to ask them what features we’re willing to pay for.  So you release a new app lock out all the previous functions and decide to charge for them. Can’t wait to see what you promise and charge more for next time. 

I have three of your units and recommended more to friends.  Guess what?  You just lost a bunch customers and sank your reputation.  Congratulations on your well thought out greedy board room decision.  Clearly you guys have no concept of customer retention and sales marketing.  Keep shooting for that 1 star you’re nearly there.

title: My Skydrop is still going strong
text: I’ve owned 2 Skydrops over the years.  My current unit is still going strong.  It works with Alexa and all of the features in the app that I use work as well.  I am very appreciative that the app and cloud access is being maintained.  My only issue is that I added the Hunter Rain-Clik bypass sensor along with the Skydrop expansion pack, but it doesn’t work.  Thanks again for continuing to support your old customers.  I’d hate to have to buy a Rachio.

title: Frustrated owner, please look for another controller
text: So unfortunate. The controller and past app worked well, and I bought in heavily with one for my parents and brother as gifts. This unit has now been hijacked of all its utility with unannounced recent software update. Paid (plenty) for a smart controller with remote capability and those remaining with what is left of the company, have decided to dumb down and take away even the remote on and off functionality, unless a monthly fee is paid. I read the response letter and appreciate the circumstance, but wiping out all functionality is truly of poor taste and feels extremely extortion like! Overall, great concept and past execution, only to be reduced to more plastic for the landfill.

title: A Concerned customer
text: Great app! Love the online weather feature and it works well automatically. I took off one star because when I turn on my sprinklers manually the sprinklers turn on and the app says “unable to start” and there is no button to turn them off and it would go unlimited spraying and the time limit is avoided because of this bug. I always have to unplug it and turn off my water valves and then reset it. It’s such a hassle. I’d be more than happy to change my review if you guys were to fix this bug. Thanks.

title: Pay for cloud access, things are worse
text:
Paid for cloud access so they can “maintain” things.  Disabled smart watering (because it wasn’t working that well), set a manual schedule with fixed days and times.  Shows the next estimated watering at a date in the future.  Lawn is drying out and having to manually water (and it constantly states it failed to start watering when I do this, have to close the app and re-open to confirm watering has started).

Oh yeah, watering history?  Never loads to show when I last watered (manually, with a custom schedule, or smart watering).  My old fashioned timer from the 70s with mechanical gears was more reliable than SkyFlop.  Will be switching to Rachio for sure next year.

title: Who is running this company?
text: Bought the controller 4 years ago as it was recommended by a friend and loved it. I recommended it to friends as well. I sent in a request for them to make it possible to manually add rainfall if we have a gauge and nothing. No updates to the software ever until recently when the essentially took away Wi-Fi functionally and requested that you pay a fee for it now. So now I have to go to the controller to manually water which was free for the last several years on the app. I’ll buy something else before paying the subscription fee. I will also right a review with your integrated apps such as Nest and encourage friends not to buy this product.

title: Fraud
text: Had this product for 2+ years and for the company to take features away from customers and make them premium services is fraudulent.    What a poor marketing decision to make to milk customers who already paid for the hardware.    If you wanted to make new functionality to the system and then charge for the new functionality as a premium services that would be ok.   But to take existing functionality available on any WiFi sprinkler system and charge monthly charges for basic use is like the car dealership charging you $1.99 a month for your key remote to unlock your car. Plus, troubleshooting the different watering stations are so easy since you can just use your phone … no more running back and forth the manually test the stations. Plus the app allows changing water restrictions “on the fly” (something important for us experiencing the drought here in Texas).

The app has a friendly, intuitive design that makes me wonder why Rainbird never thought of coming out with a WiFi controller before this. The interface between the app and the browser are very smooth … so going back and forth between desktop and mobile is very easy.

My only suggestion would be to allow landscape mode on the iPad. Other than that, this is a solid app that makes taking control of your sprinklers easy and painless.

title: Lost confidence in the app
text:
Update:  Thanks I'll try the support line. It sure would be nice if the app could tell me if/when the controller gets disconnected. The controller itself just shows green, so I have no indication that anything is wrong until I find the system doing something unexpected.

--------------
Update:
I've now lost almost all confidence in the app. The app says one thing, but the system does another:
1.  I get notifications from the app that it's going to skip watering because it has been raining. Great!
2.  I check the app, and indeed it says that it's not going to water for the next few days. Great!
3. The unit begins watering at the next opportunity. Really?  :/

This has happened multiple times now. I just can't recommend this system anymore with all of the difficulties I've had now with the unit. 

---------------------
In general, the app works well and provides a nice interface to schedule watering.

One request:  it would be nice to have a way to skip the next watering cycle. Right now, the user must disable watering before and re-enable after to skip a single cycle. Perhaps options could be presented on the Watering Forecast to manually skip cycles.

title: Quick, easy, and intuitive
text:
I've been using this for over a year now, and results have been amazing!  
Setup was a breeze, and I've seen a drop in my water bill while having a much greener and healthier landscape. Its awesome being able to spot water a zone if it needs extra attention, but, due to the ease of adjusting the zones, I haven't had to do much in that department.
I recently had a valve fail on me.  The app and controller both notified me of the shorted valve and troubleshooting the solenoid to replacement was quick and easy! The controller even continued normal watering, taking that zone out of rotation, until I managed to replace the solenoid.
Overall, this is the most trouble free and easy to manage component of my home automation system :)

title: This thing is going back  today...
text:
I bought this system two weeks ago. It has never worked right.  This system is way too expensive considering how unpolished it is. I didn't expect to be the beta tester when paying double the price of the average controller. Issues:

1.  Doing a custom schedule for a zone allows adding several different start times within the same schedule. (Ex 3x/day) Adding more than one session in the same schedule resulted in the system not doing any of them. I had to schedule each start time as a separate schedule and even then it will occasionally miss one of the waterings. 

2. The app and website are very clunky. You can see what is scheduled to happen, but not whether or not it actually did happen. This info may not be necessary if it wouldn't have missed several watering sessions.   

3. It seems the programing lives on their cloud server, not the controller. If you loose wifi connection, the system will not run your programmed schedule. This is a problem if you are starting a new lawn and trying to force frequent waterings.  

4. As of yesterday, the app NO LONGER  WORKS AT ALL. The when you launch the app, you get an immediate connection error. I am sure this is a problem with the app because you can still login to the system from the website, just not the app.

title: Great idea, confusing app
text:
I love the thought behind this app, but the execution is a little off. For instance, on the home screen I see a row of dates Sat-Fri, but it's always the first week of the month instead of this week. Similarly, when I tap Watering Information, I get weather and precipitation data for yesterday, today, the last day of last month, and the first four days of this month. Huh? The arrow buttons that I would assume should take me back and forth a week either do nothing or crash the app. 

The device itself is somewhat difficult to keep connected to wifi even though the router is directly above it and there is a very strong signal in the garage. I'm not thrilled with this system.

title: Drops off te cloud intermittantly
text: Keeps dropping it's connection to the cloud so it's hit or miss if I can use the iPhone app to adjust or add a watering. I'm paying 10 bucks a month for the app soooo. I've got a top notch WiFi router and strong signal throughout the property. Discussions between me, Skydrop and my router manufacturer have determined that the Skydrop doesn't work on the 5ghz WiFi signal. My router (eero) has dual 5.0 & 2.4ghz antennas so It's Skydrops shortcoming. I certainly am not going to disable the 5ghz antenna as Skydrop suggested just for my sprinklers, when the rest of my home is finally running flawlessly on my WiFi mesh network. Otherwise, yeah, it turns the sprinklers on and off but I mainly got this for the ease of access via an app. So...disappointed.

title: Version 2.2.1 fixed my phantom zone
text: I have been using Skydrop for a year, and am really pleased with product. It is much nicer to work with than the old RainBird controller in my garage. The Skydrop controller responds quickly now that I added an Airport Express in bedroom above the garage to extend my WiFi network. About four months ago, however, my Zone 4 lost its name on the mobile app (but not webpage). As a result, I could not edit or review settings for that zone on mobile app. The latest version fixed that problem, presumably caused by my long and descriptive name for that zone.

title: It's just ok...
text:
The app works, but I find it confusing to use. There really needs to be some polish on the organization and layout. Also, it would be great if the watering forecast was more accurate. I know Skydrop says it uses "hyper-local" weather reports to determine watering schedules, but it doesn't seem all that accurate to me.  I've seen my sprinkler run on the same days that it's rained, even though I have the unit set in "automatic" mode.

Additionally, Skydrop has been promising to release a controller firmware update for MONTHS to enable a rain or flow sensor. They still have not delivered on this promise and I'm getting tired or waiting.

title: Love the App Control for Yard Irrigation
text:
The app is the best part about the Skydrop wifi enabled irrigation controller. With iPhone nearby, I can check the water situation for my backyard. Not at home? No worries. Use the app to add a little water to any zone while away.

Easy to install. Setup is very thorough if you chose to input all the drip system info and, of course, makes your system smarter. I'm impressed how well our plants (just planted at the end of spring) are doing despite the 100+ temperatiures we're having in California. Nice to save water and see the plants thrive.

title: Great Product - App needs some fine tuning
text:
The hardware was easy to install, but I had to move my WiFi access point to be able to control it.

The App is easy to use and nicely designed. One annoying shortcoming is that it insists on being run in portrait mode. That's a real pain on an iPad Pro with a keyboard attached.

I'd also like to be able to fine tune the Smartwatering times for individual zones, but haven't been able to find a way to do that. I've resorted to manually running the zones that are being underwatered. A simple ratio, or "More <-> Less" slider would help a lot.

title: Would like to see accurate watering outlook
text: The entire setup is great, but the one thing that bugs since I've owned this device is watering outlook. I would like to see a more accurate outlook so I know when I need to manually water newly planted flowers on our drip. The app tells us that it's going to drop that day, so we won't water those plants. The next day I log into the app to look at history and it shows me that it didn't water and not going to water for another week. So I water the plants and again when I log into the app, it shows me it watered the same day. Very frustrating, but everything else I like so three stars.

title: FANTASTIC
text: I bought this at Lowe's.  I was amazed at how easy it was to install.  The videos available from scanning the QR on the packaging made it super easy.  My son actually did all the wiring as I went to the garage for a drill bit!  This has cut my watering way down and shrubs are doing better because we aren't over watering.  The app is AMAZING.  The app on the iPad is even better with weather, zones, forecast, history, and controls.  Customizable so you can name the zones schedule.  Anything and everything at your fingertips.

title: Skydrop saving money
text:
We have been using Skydrop for two months. This month with very little precipitation I have seen our water bill drop $40. All of our plants are doing well, the temperature has hovered around or above 90 for every day, so they did not lack for water. Nothing else changed in our regular use, so I believe it was the Skydrop's regulation of the water on our plants that made the difference. 

We have nine zoned scheduled and the Skydrop keeps up with them perfectly.

title: Skydrop
text:
This system has saved me more than half of my water bill. It is installed at my house in Hawaii and I can monitor the system from my home in California. The smart watering works like a charm. The only problem is : no soil type for lava so I chose sandy and it works very well. I am waiting for the water and flow sensors to fully control the system for broken piping and over watering. 
Recommend for 2nd homes for unattended watering and main home for reducing water consumption.

title: Watering Restrictions
text:
While there are some watering restrictions available, it would be nice to have a way to set not only the time, but the duration.

In SoCal, we are only able to water on certain days and only for a certain amount of time per station. 

Setting the time per station is not easy; even from the web application.  Using +- can be tedious when it starts at 40 mins and you have to hit - many, many times to get to 15 mins.  Especially if you have 8 zones.

title: Great product and app-
text: Would like the option to leave the controller lcd screen on displaying time and weather. Maybe cycle through that and water forecast so there is no risk of screen persistence. Or maybe cycle to the Skydrop logo bouncing around like a screen saver. It seems a waste to have that screen and not display the current weather. I will note, mine is installed in my main living space just under my thermostat. It looks nice but would be great as a weather display and clock.

title: Skydrop drops
text:
Customer install rep was great. BUT this is my second unit and second summer it constantly drops from cloud connection usually when there is no one avail to call due to time difference  yet everything else in my house is working on internet.  the design concept is poor a push and turn dial is a poor feature.
Thankfully I'm only out $20 for the cost of the wifi extender will be looking for another brand this was offered by water district so thought it would work better great idea and concept but poorly designed.

title: Easy to learn and use
text: After living for years with trying to manually adjust water settings based on rain timing, or lack of it, I decided to try SkyDrop for a "Smart" solution.  I have been impressed with the easy of setup and how the watering algorithms have kept water usage down and my lawn in healthy shape.  Would recommend the product to others looking to simplify a part of their lawn care lives.

title: Great product
text: Not convinced it truly takes the cooler weather into consideration and when there's a 90% chance of rain tomorrow, it would be nice to see it skip today's watering. Also would love to see it working fully with IFTTT and SmartThings.  Specifically the ability to turn it off myself based on weather forecasts since it doesn't do such a great job at considering the future.  Otherwise, I love it.

title: NOT FREE APP
text: I thought this app was great.  I've been using it since April.  I've been playing with the different options and finally get it to the point where I think I have it tweaked just right to manage my lawn.  Then when checking on something in the app, it says my trial was over...no more manual Controll with this app unless I pay a $6/ Mo the subscription....to use $300 equipment I bought from them.  I'm a little ticked about this since I don't recall anywhere that it required a monthly subscription, nor did the sales rep mention it.  At least I can still control it from the website, or else I'd ask for my money back.

title: Water restrictions needs work
text: Despite what the company's customer service insists, if you put in a water restriction as an overall criteria but identify specific zones as unrestricted--it still uses the restriction for all zones.  Why then do you have the ability to disable restrictions for specific zones???  My workaround has been to create my own time and schedule for specific zones (via personal schedules). However, this loses all the cool features of being automatically modified based on rain or heat of day.  FIX THIS PLEASE!

title: I have had Skydrop for two years now and love it.
text:
Here are my reasons:

- simple to setup

-smart watering automatically looks at the forecast and takes care is the scheduling for you. You can also setup a schedule if you prefer. Using smart watering has saved me a ton of money by not watering when it's raining outside or on cloudy/cool days. 

-at my house I have 12 zones. I can't even begin to tell you how nice it is to turn on a zone with my smart phone to isolate a leak or broken sprinkler. 

-amazing customer support. I had to make a call when I was having an issue updating to a new router. The customer service had this resolved within 5 minutes.

Please Note: good wifi signal is important!!

title: Very good product
text: This is a great product.  Can water from my iPhone,iPad from anywhere.  Easily change programming, name zones, and set different schedules.  Nice to be able to turn on any zone from your iPhone when working on problem sprinklers.  I haven't had a chance to use Smartwatering yet but if it works as well as the rest of the product it should be great.

title: So far so good...
text: Setup was a breeze and it has worked great so far. I previously had a rainbird box with an outdoor rain sensor that never seemed to serve its purpose. Skydrop is great at making sure I'm not watering if there's rain, or rain coming. Being able to setup schedules remotely from my phone and also turning sprinklers on or off is super convenient! I haven't had to work with customer service yet, if that experience is positive i would give 5 stars.

title: Be Careful - Bad wifi, bad info
text:
This unit requires full strength WiFi so if you are not placing it close to your router or if you don't want to buy an extender like I did avoid this product.

I have had the unit for several months and it is VERY erratic. I cannot trust the watering forecast. Zones are skipped and duplicated. Customer service tries to defend this as the "intelligent" feature of this unit but it just doesn't got the conditions.

You can get different results on your start page if you refresh vs starting the app. It is quite irrational. Customer service only tries to defend these irrational results.

Another frustration is that it constantly disconnects from WiFi and isn't smart enough to reconnect without manual action.

Do not buy this product until they perfect it.

title: Reported Bugs take a while
text:
The Skydrop concept is a great way to implement monitoring rain on the zones where irrigation sprinklers will be used. The process involves selecting the nearest local weather station to the site and Support is willing to change this when contacted.

The software on Windows and the App are slightly different. There's no help text and unwanted schedules can only be switched off but not deleted. They both need tidying up for improving consistency. 

Some glaring ones are visible in Skydrop's advertising. I'm talking about today always being 0 F and the mixed use of water drop symbols (solid and empty). 

My schedule is shown in a Future schedule page one day in advance.

By closely monitoring its performance I caught it promising impossible scheduling.

What I like is the flexibility and wealth of available options.

title: Terrible app
text: In general the app never works. I can never manually start watering out of the schedule times. It just spins trying to start watering. I have called support they blamed it on the connection. So I ran a network drop and put a wifi router within 2 ft of the control panel. I still can't get the manual watering to work from the app. I ran a packet capture and nothing is being sent from the app to the controller. Terrible design. Don't wast your money. The system itself took months and 4 different replacement units before it functioned correctly. They need to fire whoever writes the user guide and setup videos.

title: Set it, forget it, and save!
text: Love this controller. It's super intuitive, easy to set up,  and it is set it and forget it. I've had it for two seasons and have saved about 30% of the water I used to use. It has been rated is more efficient than others on the market, works well, and is competitively priced. Highly recommend

title: Effective Irrigation Manager
text: I've been using Skydrop for over a year now. It took a few weeks to "dial in" appropriate settings for my yard's various zones. The app is very good at tracking weather conditions and varying the amount and frequency of water to be applied based on the real world conditions and the type of vegetation and soil in each zone. Not perfect, but better than what I had to do manually on my own.

title: Easy to setup and use!
text: The Skydrop app pairs perfectly with the Skydrop smart watering unit. I was able to quickly connect once I had the unit on my wi-if network and use the app to setup all of my watering zones. I almost never have to go to the unit itself because the app is so easy to use and very well integrated.

title: Efficient
text: Since I've installed my Skydrop about 2 years ago, my 8 zone sprinkler system has been automated based on weather and environment.  I couldn't ask for anything better to control my watering habits which has saved me $$$ and made my life easier. Both Controller and app are simply awesome!

title: Smart watering needs better tuning
text:
Skydrop app says the next scheduled watering is at least 4 days away due to incoming bad weather over the next week. So far so good and that night an almighty storm rolls through which dumps Lake Michigan on our lawn  and knocks down a few small trees. 

The next morning I wake up to a notification from skydrop telling me at 6am that all zones will start watering!!

title: Excellent Product and App
text: Combination of smart design, flexible options, and convenient features make Skydrop and the app a fantastic addition to your home irrigation system. The ability to turn zones on and off from your mobile device while adjusting sprinkler heads is invaluable!!

title: Easy to operate
text: After a few settings describing our sprinkler zones, I have let the Skydrop take over our irrigation system. It is connected to our home network and the smart water feature only waters when rain is not in the forecast. Great system!!!

title: Sprinkling in high wind conditions...
text: Is there a command in the software to curtail watering if the wind speed is in excess of "X" miles an hour and water when it goes below that threshold? I live in an area where at times the wind greatly effects watering. If not, I sure would like to see that function if all possible.

title: Unstable app lets this system down
text:
The concept is great and the controller is advanced. But this app is another story. Issues I had had on the latest version:

- Last water date on the home screen is never correct. Doesn't seem to update. 
- Watering history and water forecast can be wildly inconsistent between the two  
- When I alter the watering schedule of one zone when I save and go back to the home screen one of my other zones will have lost all info and ability to select it's options (becomes a blank zone)
- No support for rain sensor. We have been waiting for this for over 6 months. Controllers built in the 80s have rain sensors incorporated for goodness sakes!

title: Great app, useful hardware
text: I didn't really think about how useful this would be when I installed it. I don't have to worry about setting rain delays manually. I can easily activate my sprinklers when I need to adjust spray patterns or test a replaced head. Great support and the app is continually improved.

title: Extremely disappointed
text: I installed this controller thinking it would be great to manager my sprinklers remotely while I'm out of home. They just disabled all of the features that make this system so great(when it actually worked) and now if you want to water remotely or do any sort of configuration you have to pay monthly subscription fees. So right now this overly priced controller is as useful as a $30 unit from any hardware store lacking any remote capabilities unless you pay for this overly priced irrigation controller.

title: One less thing to worry about
text: I've had Skydrop for over a year now and after the initial set up, I haven't had to touch it. My neighbor has his sprinklers set up on a timer and his yard is soaked while I use less water and have a better looking lawn.

title: Great Product and App!
text:
My yard stays green all the time. SkyDrop is a great way to protect the environment and save on water bills. I have been running for almost three years. I set it and forget it. I only change the number of Drip emitters I use in my yard. 

Great price for an 8 station clock too.

title: Love it
text: Replaced our old Rainbird control. Couldn't have been easier.  Love the functionality and programming features. Tech support via email was amazingly responsive - responded and resolved the issue within hours.

title: Love this app and product.
text:
I can't believe the big sprinkler companies haven't gone down this road.  I love my Skydrop.  Not only is it automated, but if I'm doing maintenance on the sprinklers, I can turn the zones off and on without having to walk back to the controller to turn it on/off. 

You can tweak the system to take in to mind the zone make up (type of heads, # of heads, plant composition, etc.)

I have two units and I can switch between the two units in the app with little fuss.  

This is the must have home automation product!!

title: Good app
text:

My only suggestions would be to add a separate unit or household easier so I don't have to create two separate accounts for two properties. 

And to allow for a security feature that turns on sections of sprinklers of motion is detected.

title: Dynamic watering is on point
text: My lawn looks great thanks to this app. No more rainy day watering, too! I would love to see a pause option with user adjustable durations. A feature like that would be extremely useful if sprinklers noticeably  lower water pressure when showering.

title: Excellent app for the best device!!!

title: Great User Friendly App

title: Very polished - great irrigation system

title: Great app and controller
text: I love the app and controller. Very easy to set up and track watering through the app from anywhere! Keep improvements coming! Would be nice to set a conservation mode that would water bare minimum needed to keep grass and trees healthy while conserving water.

title: Awesome app for an awesome system!!!

title: Disappointing

title: It works as advertised.

title: Easy to use

title: Mediocre app

Please streamline this app a little more. It has a clunky feel. I bought the Skydrop expecting a Nest experience.

title: It could be better
text: I want to love the shydrop but I can't for the moment and I'm trying to give it more time, I think the rain forecast is hit or miss many time it water and it rain at the end of the day, the app could be made little bit more simpler and fun and adding Iffft would be great

title: Add these features please

title: Simple, Functional and as expected

title: App was great until last update no fix in site

title: Smart and Simple
text: I've had Skydrop for 25 months. Overall it has been a great part of my home management systems.  I especially like how it lets me tell it how type of soil is in the zone, what kind of sprinkler heads are in the zone (I have rotors, rotary nozzles, and regular nozzles through the various zones), and even the slope of the yard/bed in that zone.  I also have Nest products, and since Skydrop "works with Nest", I get a monthly update on my water usage in my Nest Home Report, as it includes Skydrop watering info.  That info help me determine how much I'm using in my home as my municipal water bill gives me a grand total for home and sprinklers.  I rated the app as 4 stars because there were some issues with the controller, or the app, a couple of months back.  I think they finally updated everything, because I haven't had any issues in the last few weeks.  All I needed to do was reset the controller to make it work again, which was a hassle, but infrequent.  Lastly, some people complain about the controller's ability to water or not water when it is raining, or when it has rained.  I use the IFTTT (If This, Then That) app, in conjunction with the Skydrop app.  Between the two, I'm never watering while it is raining.  When you properly tell Skydrop how much watering time your yard needs, it is very smart and knows when to not water after a recent rain.  Take a yard rain gauge, put it in your yard, and measure the amount of water over a given time.  I know how much time each zone needs to run to give my yard 1" of rain every 4 days.  Skydrop gets it all done, giving the water enough time to soak in (especially on hills), so that my roots grow deep and I give my yard the 1" of water it needs.
